title: Great Sand Dunes National Park & Preserve: Support Your Park
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Support Your Park             Support Your Park         Volunteer leading environmental education program along Medano Creek   Volunteer Opportunities Volunteers are very important to the success of Great Sand Dunes. They serve in all branches of the park's operations, including trails, computer database management, Visitor Center operations, interpretive programs, and campground hosting. Some serve a few days a year for special events, while others live in the park and work a 40 hour week. To inquire about volunteer options and opportunities, please email Eric Valencia or call him at 719-378-6349. Thanks for your interest in volunteering!          Friends of the Dunes is a non-profit citizen's support group for Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve. In cooperation with the National Park Service, the Friends provide a forum for citizen involvement in planning decisions, focus public interest on issues and need, and provide volunteer and financial aid for projects beyond the scope of the park's budget. Support Friends of the Dunes!        Artist in Residence Kathy Hodge, 2009 NPS/Patrick Myers  Great Sand Dunes Artist in Residence Program
